page.title: 05MERTON CHURCH
page.content: The Church was rebuilt in 1379 at the time that King Richard II was on the throne.There are two sorts of windows, Perpendicular and Gothic.If you went back to the 1780s - 1790s you would have found a spire. To get the money to knock it down they sold the bells. That's why we don't hear bells on Sunday.In the Church is a Norman font which is 200years older than the Church. The roof was made higher in the 1480s.The timbers are 500years old.The pulpit was put in 300years later.St Swithin is the saint of the Church. There is a stoup,sepelchre and redeliah. All date from medieval times.The sedial is a group of three small seats especially for the priests. The stoup is a special place where you get Holy Water to make the sign of the cross with.Buried in the Churchyard is the priest who buried Napolean.
